conclusion: Understanding the relationship between the light source, objects, and shadows
Shadow A is cast by a hand sculpture, positioned to the left and slightly forward
Shadow B is cast by a shoe, positioned to the right and slightly forward
Shadow C is cast by a small object, positioned to the right and slightly behind
Shadow D is cast by a roll of tape, positioned to the left and slightly behind
Light source moving downward changes the angle of light hitting objects
Shadows become longer and more elongated as light source moves downward
Positions of shadows shift, moving further away and changing orientation
Sizes of shadows increase as light source moves downward
Shadow A moves further left and slightly forward, becoming longer and more elongated
Shadow B moves further right and slightly forward, becoming longer and more elongated
Shadow C moves further right and slightly behind, becoming longer and more elongated
Shadow D moves further left and slightly behind, becoming longer and more elongated
Shadows move further away, become longer and more elongated, and increase in size
